title: Police & Fire: Crash victim ‘critical’
content:
DRIVER INJURED: A Holt man injured in a single-vehicle traffic accident was in critical condition Thursday, according to the Calhoun County Sheriff Department. David Cavanaugh, 34, was taken to Bronson Methodist Hospital in Kalamazoo after the crash on N Drive North near 11-Mile Road in Pennfield Township. Hospital officials said they did not have a condition report to release. Officers reported the crash at 3:52 p.m. Wednesday and said Cavanaugh was eastbound and lost control of his minivan after passing another vehicle. Deputies said Thursday they would like to the driver of a black pickup truck who may have been passed by the minivan just before the crash to call the sheriff department.
SHOOTING VICTIM: A 19-year-old woman injured in an accidental shooting has improved. Breana Gaskell was reported in serious condition Thursday at Bronson Methodist Hospital in Kalamazoo. She was shot about 12:20 p.m. Monday while walking with a 13-year-old boy in the 100 block of Clarence Boulevard in Pennfield Township. Calhoun County Sheriff Department deputies said the two had been target shooting when the shotgun the boy was carrying discharged, hitting Gaskell in the right side of her body. Deputies said Thursday they are seeking charges in juvenile court against the boy for reckless discharge of a weapon.
